Menperin Genjot Produksi Industri Manufaktur untuk Perbaiki Kinerja Ekspor
04 Nov 2019, 21:05 by Magdalena


Menperin Genjot Produksi Industri Manufaktur untuk Perbaiki Kinerja Ekspor

KBRN, Jakarta: Kementerian Perindustrian mendorong peningkatan produksi industri manufaktur, untuk mendukung peningkatan ekspor nasional. Menteri Perindustrian Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita mengatakan, produk manufaktur Indonesia sudah banyak yang memenuhi standar untuk berkompetisi di pasar internasional.
“Sejumlah industri manufaktur sedang digenjot produktivitas untuk memenuhi permintaan pasar ekspor. Contohnya industri otomotif, makanan dan minuman, serta aneka industri yang potensial ditingkatkan ekspornya,” kata Agus di Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019)
Ia tidak mengakui kondisi ekonomi global yang sedang menurun, telah menekan industri manufaktur nasional, namun Menperin optimis perluasan pasar ekspor seperti ke kawasan Asia Pasifik, Timur Tengah dan Afrika, akan meningkatkan produksi industri manufaktu dan memperbaiki kinerja ekspor Indonesia.
Data Kemenperin menyebutkan, sepanjang Januari-September 2019, nilai pengapalan produk sektor manufaktur mencapai USD 93,7 miliar, atau memberikan kontribusi sebesar 75,51 persen terhadap total ekspor nasional yang mencapai USD 124,1 miliar.
“Itu artinya, peran hilirisasi industri dalam meningkatkan nilai tambah juga berjalan. Oleh karena itu, Kementerian Perindustrian bersama Kementerian Perdagangan akan senantiasa berusaha keras untuk membuka dan memperdalam pasar ekspor,” tukas Menperin Agus.
Agus menambahkan, Kemenperin juga fokus untuk memperdalam struktur manufaktur di dalam negeri sekaligus memperkuat rantai nilai bahan baku dan bahan penolong. Misalnya di industri petrokimia, dengan upaya revitalisasi TubanPetro dan perluasan usaha PT Chandra Asri Petrochemical.
Sedangkan, di industri logam dasar, sedang diupayakan untuk merevitalisasi PT Krakatau Steel dan mengoptimalkan pengoperasian di Kawasan Industri Morowali. Sesuai peta jalan Making Indonesia 4.0, pemerintah memprioritaskan pengembangan lima sektor manufaktur yang dinilai mampu memberikan kontribusi besar terhadap pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional. Kelima sektor tersebut, yaitu industri makanan dan minuman, tekstil dan pakaian, otomotif, kimia, serta elektronika. “Tidak hanya menyasar kepada sektor skala besar saja, kami juga tetap memprioritaskan pada pengembangan industri kecil dan menengah (IKM) yang juga menunjukkan geliat yang baik untuk berperan meningkatkan pertumbuhan sektor industri manufaktur,” jelas Agus.
Untuk jangka menengah dan panjang, lanjut Agus, Kemenperin juga terus memacu pembangunan kawasan industri di berbagai daerah di Indonesia yang terkait dengan upaya menjaga ketersediaan bahan baku dan sektor strategis. Kemenperin menargetkan sebanyak 18 kawasan industri di luar Jawa sudah dapat beroperasi hingga akhir tahun 2019. Ke-18 kawasan industri tersebut berpotensi akan menarik investasi sebesar Rp250 triliun dan menyerap tenaga kerja langsung sebanyak 900 ribu orang.
Ke-18 kawasan industri luar Jawa itu, berlokasi di Lhoukseumawe, Ladong, Medan, Tanjung Buton, Landak, Maloy, Tanah Kuning, dan Bitung. Selanjutnya di Kuala Tanjung, Kemingking, Tanjung Api-api, Gandus, Tanjung Jabung, Tanggamus, Batulicin, Jorong, Buli, dan Teluk Bintuni.

Minister of Industry Boosts Manufacturing Industry Production to Improve Export Performance
Nov. 04 2019, 21:05 by Magdalena


Minister of Industry Boosts Manufacturing Industry Production to Improve Export Performance

KBRN, Jakarta: The Ministry of Industry is pushing for an increase in manufacturing industrial production, to support an increase in national exports. Minister of Industry Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita said that many Indonesian manufacturing products had met the standards to compete in the international market.
"A number of manufacturing industries are being boosted by productivity to meet export market demands. For example the automotive industry, food and beverage, and various industries that have the potential to increase exports, "Agus said in Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019)
He did not recognize that the declining global economic conditions had pressured the national manufacturing industry, but the Minister of Industry was optimistic that the expansion of export markets, such as the Asia Pacific, Middle East and Africa, would increase industrial industrial production and improve Indonesia's export performance.
Data from the Ministry of Industry states, during January-September 2019, the value of shipments of the manufacturing sector products reached USD 93.7 billion, or contributed 75.51 percent to the total national exports which reached USD 124.1 billion.
"That means, the role of downstream industries in increasing added value is also running. Therefore, the Ministry of Industry and the Ministry of Trade will always try hard to open and deepen the export market, "said Minister of Industry Agus.
Agus added, the Ministry of Industry also focused on deepening the structure of domestic manufacturing while strengthening the value chain of raw materials and supporting materials. For example in the petrochemical industry, with the revitalization of Tuban Petro and the expansion of PT Chandra Asri Petrochemical's business.
Meanwhile, in the basic metal industry, efforts are being made to revitalize PT Krakatau Steel and optimize operations in the Morowali Industrial Estate. In accordance with the Making Indonesia 4.0 road map, the government prioritizes the development of five manufacturing sectors which are considered capable of making a major contribution to national economic growth. The five sectors, namely the food and beverage industry, textiles and clothing, automotive, chemical, and electronics. "Not only targeting the large-scale sector, we also continue to prioritize the development of small and medium industries (IKM) which also shows a good stretch to play a role in increasing the growth of the manufacturing industry sector," explained Agus.
For the medium and long term, continued Agus, the Ministry of Industry also continues to spur the development of industrial estates in various regions in Indonesia related to efforts to maintain the availability of raw materials and strategic sectors. The Ministry of Industry targets 18 industrial estates outside Java to be operational by the end of 2019. The 18 industrial estates will potentially attract investment of Rp 250 trillion and absorb 900 thousand direct workers.
The 18 industrial estates outside Java are located in Lhoukseumawe, Ladong, Medan, Tanjung Buton, Hedgehog, Maloy, Tanah Kuning, and Bitung. Then in Kuala Tanjung, Kemingking, Tanjung Api-api, Gandus, Tanjung Jabung, Tanggamus, Batulicin, Jorong, Buli, and Bintuni Bay.
